page.title: 16PERTENHALL MANOR
page.content: { Pertenhall Manor}is a listed Tudor building.In 1870 one half was rebuilt. The external facade now rendered retains its Tudor style, the internal architecture is a mixture of the Tudor, Stuart and Victorian periods, with some unique Victorian stained glass windows. The dining room still retains its superb oak panelling dating back to Charles I. The manor stands in 8 acres and is practically self sufficient.The lands are mentioned in the Domesday Book and the present tennis court is the site of a Cromwellian burial ground. The present owners have lived in the manor for twelve years,and it is essentially a home with all the rooms in use,as they have a large family. The beautiful gabled house is said to have a ghost, but the house has a serene almost magical atmosphere.
